entry.title: Book: Robinson Crusoe, by Daniel Defoe (1719) (2)
entry.content:
Book: Robinson Crusoe, by Daniel Defoe (1719) (2)20150623
I'm stilling reading this, although clearly a bit slowly. It's
amazing how slow and simple things develop on the island. The
religious nature of the story is very interesting, especially once
Friday comes on to the island.
  • Books
  • 1719

entry.title: Movie: Dracula Untold, starring Luke Evans (2014) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: Dracula Untold, starring Luke Evans (2014) (2)20150621
We watched this with my parents and I liked it on the second
viewing as well. I was annoyed with Vlad's unwillingness to destroy
them the first two nights rather than staying with his family, but
the whole story was still pretty awesome. I don't get a strong
sense that he really had an "insatiable" desire for blood, because
he was only interested when he saw it.
  • Movies
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: Jupiter Ascending, starring Mila Kunis (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Jupiter Ascending, starring Mila Kunis (2015)20150620
This movie had a lot going for it but also a lot of terrible stuff
in it too. I love the oldness of the world, but a lot of the
details were either stupid or stupidly portrayed. It felt like
there was a book that someone loved but they could only put in the
key scenes, because so much was elided and skimmed over.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Jurassic World, starring Chris Pratt (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Jurassic World, starring Chris Pratt (2015)20150618
This was much better than I thought it was going to be and really
good itself. I loved how the theme park really felt like a park
with the kinds of things a park would have. I thought the action
was fun and the dinosaurs were cool. I like the nods to the
original movie too.

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 10 - Mother's Mercy
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 10 - Mother's Mercy20150615
Wow, so much has changed in this episode. It's amazing.

I'm very surprised by what happened to Stannis. I'm surprised
that the sacrifice worked in one sense but totally failed in
another. Another character gone.

I'm curious about Ser Robert Strong... Cersei is gonna have hell
to pay next season.

I wonder if because of Myrcella, Jaime will just turn around and
attack.

I can't believe Arya's blind... what the heck!?

Dany's alone and captured by another Dothraki horde... or were
they circling her in a sign of fealty?

I'm most surprised by Jon Snow's death. Wow. What a great
character and perhaps the only hope for Westeros dead. Jeepers.

--

I'm realizing that Bran never showed up at all in this season. Weird.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Movie: Kingsman, starring Taron Egerton (2014)
entry.content:
Movie: Kingsman, starring Taron Egerton (2014)20150613
I like the style of the movie a lot. The cast and acting were
stellar too. The story was neat. I think the language was really
stupidly vulgar for no purpose, unlike American Sniper for instance
it didn't seem like the characters would really talk that way. 

I think a lot of the violence was shot in a really cool way, but
was pointless and not "heroic" violence at all. In particular, the
extended church seen was pretty terrible as we just have to watch
in horror as innocent people are killed by each other and a super
spy. You can't feel good about the spy's skills in a scene like
that.
  • Movies
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: American Sniper, starring Bradley Cooper (2014)
entry.content:
Movie: American Sniper, starring Bradley Cooper (2014)20150612
I thought this movie was a very "real" and "raw" depiction of one
guy's experience. I felt like it really emphasized how stupid the
war was although that doesn't mean the soldiers weren't heroic and
caring towards each other. The ending was terrible... real life. :(
  • Movies
  • 2014

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest 2 (iOS, 2014) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Dragon Quest 2 (iOS, 2014) (2)20150609
I had to wait at the RMV for about an hour today so I played a lot
of DQ2. I had some other opportunities to play too and I ended up
getting all three characters and doing a bit of grinding to get
the Princess powerful enough to survive the journey. This is a
simple and fun game. It doesn't give you much direction but there
also isn't a lot of opportunity to go to the wrong place, since
there are so few places. I really enjoy it though!

Total time: 3:01
  • Video Games
  • Dragon Quest 2
  • iOS
  • 2014

entry.content:
Game: Dragon Quest 2 (iOS, 2014)20150608
I started this today because I put down FF:RK and realized that I
needed something meaningful to play when I was bored on my
iPhone. So far I've just done a little grinding trying to save up
for equipment. The language is very fun like DQ1 and I love the
vertical layout.

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy Record Keeper (iOS, 2015)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy Record Keeper (iOS, 2015)20150608
I've played this game every day for a little less than two
weeks. It's the first free-to-play game like this that I've tried
other than an incredibly brief stint playing Puzzle & Dragons.

I find the game very addictive, although I haven't spent any
money, which I'm glad about. The boss battles are fun and it's
nice to plan a combination that destroys them, just like in the
normal games. The grind through enemies is really easy and not
very interesting, but because of the mechanics of the game, it is
really annoying.

Pros: The boss battles, the nostalgia, the graphics, and that I
don't feel like I need to pay money.

Cons: The user interface is terrible and it is very difficult to
manage my inventory and characters. The inventory limits are very
annoying and make me got manage things before every battle. I hate
that I feel like I've missed cool characters and things because I
didn't start at the beginning of the game's release. 

The thing that I hate the most, however, is that the Stamina
system and Daily Events make me feel like I have to play all the
time. If I just bought the game and could play whenever I wanted,
then I'd play it whenever I felt like it, when I was bored or
waiting for something. But, because I can only do 50-ish points of
actions, I feel like I need to use them all up and then once they
are filled up again, I have to check again. This is really
annoying and makes me feel like I should play even more than I
would want to otherwise. This is worsened by the Events, which
will expire and I won't get the reward if I don't do them by the
date. 

This is really annoying and dumb and I'm going to save myself the
grief and just delete the game.

Total time: 5:00 (estimate)
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy Record Keeper
  • iOS
  • 2015

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 9 - The Dance of Dragons
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 9 - The Dance of Dragons20150608
I can't believe Stannis. There has to be something else going on
or else this is the end of his reign. He was almost a good guy.

Arya's story is pretty intense. Is she going to get in trouble?
Is she going to become a prostitute to kill him?

Dany's story is AMAZING. I'm so pumped for her to wreck havoc and
really get the dragons back in the scene.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 8 - Hardhome
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 5 - Episode 8 - Hardhome20150601
This was a crazy episode. I like that Tyrion is now on Dany's
side and it was awesome what Arya did. I'm very depressed for
Jon's losses, but now we know the Lord Commander will have all
the fear and information he needs. Valerian steel works! Dany's
dragons can save the day? What's Bran up to? Cersei is so
low... and what did he mean by "the work continues".

I found Jon's sequence terrifying for him and I was very proud of
him when he said "Brothers, to me!" when they went to defend the
wall.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones
